intro: Cryptantha kingii, commonly known as the King's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
